info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 5 at 10:19PM EDT until May 9 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River at Hazleton.
White River at Petersburg.
.Rainfall over the last several days totaling 1 to 2 inches along the lower White River has led to minor flooding at Petersburg and minor flooding will reach Hazleton over the next day. Flooding is expected to end by Friday.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River at Petersburg.
* WHEN...Until Friday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 18.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins to flood several Pike County roads. Many of the following county roads begin to flood around this level...east of SR 57 include CR 750N...CR 600N and CR 1000E. Pike county road subject to flooding west of SR 57 include...CR 250 W...CR 400W...CR 675N...CR 700 N...CR 1000w...CR 900W...CR 700W and CR 775W.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM EDT Monday /8:45 PM CDT Monday/ the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 PM EDT Monday /8:45 PM CDT Monday/ was 16.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 18.0 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued Tuesday afternoon by around 130 PM EDT /1230 PM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FRIDAY EVENING

area.areaDesc: Daviess, IN; Gibson, IN; Knox, IN; Pike, IN
